intro: Hadrolaelia tenebrosa, commonly known as the dark-leaved orchid, is a species native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is a terrestrial orchid with a distinctive appearance, featuring dark green to almost black foliage. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
